abstract.p: New York Yankees-Florida Marlins interleague game that was rained out may not be played at all because of scheduling considerations (S)

block.p: The Yankees' game against the Florida Marlins at Yankee Stadium yesterday was postponed because of rain, but there is a real chance it will never be played. The Old-Timers' Day game was also postponed, with no makeup date announced.
The Marlins, a National League team, will not return to Yankee Stadium this season, and the Yankees share only one day off with them the rest of the season, Aug. 31.
But it would almost certainly not be possible for the Yankees to play because they will play a night game in Seattle Aug. 30.
